Page.Text: Identify ( Point) the position of the fracture on the Xray

RangeQuiz.Question: Find the largest value of the force exerted on the forefoot:

Quiz.Question: Is the biomechanic behaviour consistent with the clinic of the patient?
Which is the type of the fracture?

Page.Text: Point the two radiological findings concerning the 6.5 mm screw:( the 6.5 mm screw is the smallest one)
Point the radiological finding concerning the dynamic screw:( the dynamic screw is the largest one).

Quiz.Question: Which of the following answers are correct:
Quiz.Answer: The tip of the dynamic screw is situated much too close to the superior border of the femoral head ( the dynamic screw is the largest one)
The compression screw is not completely tightened, so compression is incomplete
The thread of the dynamic screw is situated within the fracture
The dynamic screw screw is too short

Page.Text: Identify (Point) the position of the patient Center of mass.

Quiz.Question: Do you observe any anomaly in left-right dividing of the percentage of the body weight?
Quiz.Answer: yes, the distribution is higher for the left side
yes, the distribution is higher for the right side

Quiz.Question: Please indicate the region that has an abnormal contact percentage:
